page.title: 07 Employment in Polstead.
page.content: The greater part of the survey area is agricultural land,producing sugar beet ,grain, and soft fruits, especially the famous Polstead Black Cherries.There is also a large amount of pasture land for cattle ,horses and ponies kept for leisure purposes.The Pym family at Maria Marten's cottage keep a herd of Suffolk sheep;lambs from this herd are sold as far away as Russia.These fortunate sheep have oil paintings on the walls of their pens. The arable land is light,gravelly,and well drained.At one time most men used to work on the farms,but now the tractor has taken over from the horse, the arable land is managed by a few men,mainly the owners or leasees of the farms,with a little casual help. Now there are about 250 houses,with 600 inhabitants.Some cottages are well preserved 15TH century thatch.
